Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالشَّكَّ فَإِنَّهُ يُفْسِدُ الدِّينَ وَيُبْطِلُ الْيَقِينَ
enWisdom: Be wary of doubt, for verily it corrupts religion and nullifies certitude
The worst faith is that in which doubt enters

Wisdom: صُنْ إِيمَانَكَ مِنَ الشَّكِّ فَإِنَّ الشَّكَّ يُفْسِدُ الْإِيمَانَ كَمَا يُفْسِدُ الْمِلْحُ الْعَسَلَ
enWisdom: Protect your faith from doubt, for doubt spoils faith the same way salt spoils honey
One whose doubt increases, his religion gets corrupted

Wisdom: لَا دِينَ لِمُرْتَابٍ وَلَا مُرُوَّةَ لِمُغْتَابٍ
enWisdom: The sceptic has no religion and the backbiter has no magnanimity
